description:
Hundreds of years in the future, Manhattan has become a deadly slum, run by mutant crime-lords and disinterested cops. Stuck in the middle is a young girl who thought she had no future, but learns she has a great destiny. In a world so poisoned that it doesn't notice the monsters on its streets, how can a street kid like Fray unite a fallen city against a demonic plot to consume mankind? Joss Whedon, the celebrated creator of Buffy the Vampire Slayer, brings his vision to the future in this unique tale. As inventive in the comics medium as in that of television or film, Whedon spins a complex tale of a skilled thief coming of age without the help of friends or family, guided only by a demonic Watcher.

Collects the eight-issue miniseries starring Melaka Fray.
name: TPB

description:
Overview

Plug into the hottest new series from Comics' Greatest World! Out of the pages of Barb Wire comes the most offbeat, unusual character you've seen from Dark Horse yet -- Avram Roman, the Machine! Writer John Arcudi brings you a tale of mistaken identity and retribution on the mean streets of Steel Harbor. Ted Naifeh's stunning art brings to life the tortured, half-human denizen of a decaying industrial dystopia. Don't miss this chance to see this hands-down fan-favorite character in action!
First of three consecutive issues drawn by Sean Phillips! A frightened Constantine takes refuge with old friends - but can they protect him from his own insanity?
name: The Bogeyman

description: Set just before the Angel TV show began, this comic shows the life of tragic hero Francis Allen Doyle, half-demon Irishman, before he convinced Angel to start being a hero and help the helpless once more.
name: Doyle

description: 1. Gamesmen of Asgalun -- Rite of Blood
name: Gamesmen of Asgalun

description: Daughter of Raktavashi part 2 : A Rage of Goblins -- 2. Blood of Beasts.
name: Rage of Goblins

description:
Features Include:
The Living Bomb!
The Man Who Dared!
I Saw The Impossible World!
name: The Living Bomb!

description:
Features Include:
The Coming Of The Plantman!
New Glasses
The Search for Shanng!
The Shoemaker's Strange Assistants!
name: The Coming Of The Plantman!

description:
Features Include:
The Human Torch Meets..."Captain America" - The Human Torch is tricked once again by an old personal enemy, the 'Acrobat' (see 'Strange Tales' #106). Before the real Captain America had been discovered in the ice, the bank robber turns his skills and riches into impersonating him. Johnny is fooled humiliated many times while the man goes on a rampage. However, Johnny creates a fire cage, finally capturing the man.
The Bridge
The Return of the Omnipotent Baron Mordo!
name: The Human Torch Meets... Captain America

description:
Features Include:
The Sandman Strikes!
Zero of Time
The Origin of Dr. Strange
name: The Sandman Strikes!

description:
Features Include:
In The Clutches Of The Puppet Master!
Return to the Nightmare World!
The Radio
name: In The Clutches Of The Puppet Master!

description:
Features Include:
The Return Of The Eel!
From Outer Space
The Many Traps of Baron Mordo!
name: The Return Of The Eel!

description:
Steel Harbor, the down-and-dirty industrial metropolis of Comics' Greatest World, was torn apart last summer by widespread riots among superpowered gang members. Times are tough, and the people who live there can't even count on the police!

But they can count on Barb Wire. Armed with her arsenal, motorcycle, and an attitude that just won't quit, Barb is willing to right any wrong in Steel Harbor -- if the price is right! Joined by her "partner," the hideous but helpful Machine, Barb launches a new series of gritty adventures -- with Motorhead and Wolf Gang on hand to make sure the action doesn't stop!

In this issue, Barb Wire begins a three-part struggle with Deathcard, a mysterious assassin who seems to anticipate her every move! It just doesn't get any cooler than this!
name: Devil In The Dark

description:
They came to Grinnin' Jimbo's looking for amusement. They found murder. Nothing can bring them back, but King Tiger can bring them vengeance. And he won't have to do it alone. From the pages of Ghost, King Tiger joins Motorhead for a devil hunt down New Orleans way! It'll be anything but Big Easy!

King Tiger and Motorhead search for a killer in New Orleans.

Features

  • Action Figures Episode 1: First Blood
  • Generation Sex Episode 1: Live and Learn
  • Slim & Nun Episode 1: A Tough Habit To Break
  • La-X Episode 1: Everybody Wants To Rule The World
  • Salem Episode 1: Nobody Knows, Nobody Sees...
  • Hericane Episode 1: Origin
  • Miss Adventure Episode 1: Say The Secret Word...
name: Slim and Nun

description:
While on a mission scouting Triceratons Raphael hears an old man being mugged up on the street. He starts to go help the man, but Leonardo pulls him back to help with the Triceratons, after they are defeated Raphael goes up to help the man, but he has been beaten and left by the men. Raphael helps him up but feels horrible about what has happened to him.

The other turtles find him on a roof overlooking the old man's neighborhood and Leonardo chastises him for leaving the others during a battle.

Later, Master Splinter announces that Leonardo, and only Leonardo, is ready to embark on a pilgrimage. This doesn't sit well with Raph and he heads back up to the streets where he stops a woman from being mugged. The old man from before comes out to meet Raph and asks him to return with him to his place.

The two exchange stories and the old man explains that he used to be a crime-fighter for the neigborhood. Raph has to take off because Leo is leaving and promises to come back the next evening, but while on the way he hears a shot come from the man's apartment where he finds him shot and dying from a break-in. Raph makes a promise to put the guys that did it behind bars and to keep the man's family from knowing about his crime-fighting past by getting rid of his gear. He keeps both.
name: Raphael

description:
Features Include:
The Man Who Became The Torch!
The Weatherman
The Possessed!
name: The Man Who Became The Torch!

description:
1. Untitled Superman story (Siegal/Shuster/Cassidy) - Lois and Clark are covering the war in Europe, and anxiously await the peace negotiations between Toran and Galonia. However, the Galonian delegation is blown up on its way to the meeting, and it turns out that evil genius Luthor is playing one nation against another in an attempt to dominate the world. This issue marks the first appearances of Lex Luthor, the Daily Planet (adapted from the radio show) and the DC logo in a circle on the cover.
  2. Untitled Pep Morgan story (Guardineer)
  3. "Dead Men Tell No Tales" (Moldoff) featuring the Black Pirate - First appearance.
  4. Untitled Three Aces story (Fox/Grothkopf)
  5. Untitled Tex Thomson story (Baily)
  6. Untitled Clip Carson story (Moldoff)
  7. "The Treasure Tower" (Fox/Guardineer) featuring Zatara
name: Dead Men Tell No Tales; The Treasure Tower

description:
Superman answers an ad from a wealthy industrialist whos looking for help with his gambling-addict son in "Carnahan's Heir."

  1. Untitled Superman story (Siegal/Shuster/Cassidy) - Ailing multi-millionaire Rufus Carnahan places an ad in the Daily Planet asking to see Superman. When Superman visits him, Carnahan says that his son Peter has ruined his own life by running up huge gambling debts, and asks that Superman reform him. Later, Rufus dies, and Peter is confronted by mobster Jake Brent demanding payment of his debt. When Brent is killed, Peter is convicted of his murder and sentenced to death, although he insists he is innocent. Can Superman unravel the mystery in time to save Peter?
  2. Untitled Pep Morgan story (Guardineer)
  3. Untitled Black Pirate story (Moldoff)
  4. Untitled Three Aces story (Fox/Grothkopf)
  5. Untitled Tex Thomson story (Baily)
  6. Untitled Clip Carson story (Moldoff)
  7. "The Magician Murder" (Fox/Guardineer) featuring Zatara
name: The Magician Murder

description:
Lives and identities are at stake as Lois Lane and Superman face off against a mad hypnotist!

Amnesiac Robbers -- Enemy Sub -- Captured by Captain Ruff -- The Living Statues -- The Kidnapping -- Message to the Major Part 1 -- Calero the Rebel Leader -- The One Man Crime Wave.

Superman: A number of mysterious robberies, in which guards and couriers lose large amounts of money but can't remember anything about the theft, is plaguing Metropolis. When Lois Lane visits the hypnotist Medini, who has promised to reveal Superman's true identity to her, Superman suspects that Medini could be behind the robberies. Medini has the ability to hypnotize anyone and get them to do his bidding - even Superman.
name: Amnesiac Robbers

description: It's truth or consequences for Healey when a straight-jacketed Allie shows up in Afbaghistan, while Janin must decide if her betrayal is worth the price. Back in Edgefield, Loman come to grips with his marriage to Switzer suddenly including a third member: the lovesick Flabbergast.
name: Truth and Dare

description: Auditions can be scary, especially when the team you're trying out for is the Legion of Super-Heroes! But a small-planet girl is about to make good when a big-time threat proves more than the Legion can handle. So say what you want about substitutes, we think they look pretty good together!
name: The Powers That Were

volume.name: Legion of Super-Heroes in the 31st Century

description:
Overview

MAD Classics puts a hex on Harry Potter, freaks out the Fantastic Four and picks on Pixar's Monsters, Inc.! MAD Classics also spoofs the departing Queer Eye and the returning Die Hard franchise. Plus, real-life superheroes, reality TV rejects, NASCAR whack- jobs, summer camp disasters and much more!

Trapped 14 years in the past, Takeru and friends try to figure out how they got there and how they are going to get back. They don't know that a coworker saw them disappear and he's told Takeru's half-sister Hyouju about it. Now she's teaming up with Ichigo's brother to try and solve the mystery. But is there anything they can do to help?

Martial arts enthusiast and inventor Tommy Zhou has developed a groundbreaking innovation--wrist bands that create an endless variety of weapons from solid holograms. But an evil order of assassins believes Tommy has stumbled upon the long-lost mystic technique of the Order of Wu-Shi-'the way of the Weapon'--and they're sending waves of killers after him to steal it back! Action! Fights! Advanced technology! Ancient Chinese legend! They all collide HERE!

Overview

In 2003, Dabel Brothers Productions released THE HEDGE KNIGHT and stunned the comic book world with their high quality adaptation of New York Times Best-Selling author George R. R. Martins novella which serves as a prequel to his epic novel series, A SONG OF ICE AND FIRE. In 2004, the collected graphic novel edition of THE HEDGE KNIGHT went on to become one of the best-selling graphic novels of the year. In 2006, Marvel Comics and Dabel Brothers Production republished the book in a prestige hardcover format, much to the delight of collectors and critics alike. And in Spring 2007, the Dabel Brothers will continue the story of THE HEDGE KNIGHT by adapting the next chapter in the series: George R. R. Martins THE SWORN SWORD.

Featuring the return of the creative duo of Mike S. Miller and Ben Avery, THE SWORN SWORD tells the story of the adventures of Ser Duncan and his squire one year after their initial meeting at the tournament in Ashford. After traveling the land in search of the puppeteer girl Tanselle, Dunk and Egg find themselves in the charge of Ser Eustace, an aged knight who has accepted Dunk as his sworn sword. But Ser Eustace has another knight in his service who is nothing but trouble, and he will make Dunks life far more difficult when he rashly attacks a peasant and causes grief to a local noble, the Lady Rohanne Webber. But the Lady Rohanne has problems of her ownand she knows the truth about Ser Eustace and the side he took in the battle of Redgrass Field. The long-awaited sequel to THE HEDGE KNIGHT has finally arrived!

volume.name: George R. R. Martin's The Hedge Knight II: Sword Sworn

description: A news station in San Fransisco recieves a letter from a "Dr. Bad Vibes"; at noon, his Earthquake Machine will reduce The City That Knows How to rubble. Is his threat genuine? Bruce Banner and Eddie Brock are determined to find out... as soon as they stop trying to beat each other up!
name: Rockin' The Town

description: 1. Superman Under the Red Sun! -- 2. The Return of Super-Horse!
name: Captive of the Red Sun!

description:
Overview

An indescribably powerful cosmic being gathers nine of Marvel's most mismatched super beings for purposes beyond their comprehension. Can Spider-Man, Gravity, Venom, Henry Pym, The Wasp, Medusa, Kraven, Firebird and the Hood keep from killing each other before they have to face the dangers of their destination, the deadly artificial planet known as Battleworld?

Synopsis

We start with the image of a many burying something, excerpts of a letter to a woman in the background. He talks about the most recent visitors to Battleworld, and is seen burying the Bi-Beast,a Skrull, and a member of the Kree race, all while explaining how he didn't have time to stop them from destroying one another. The image spreas out to show him finally finishing the graves, lamenting over the fact that he cannot give them a proper burial as he does not know their customs. He walks away from them, and hundreds of graves are seen.

We switch to the site of a college in mid-New York City where a young Gravity sits with his girlfriend Lauren. He watches her do work, and she is concentrating. As she glances up, he tells her that he likes the wrinkle on her cheek when she concentrates, and the two start kissing. Deciding to head to her apartment, They arrive and start kissing befor a noise comes from outside. Gravity, realizing that he must go, changes into costume and says good-bye to his girlfriend, flying into the air.

He confronts Brushfire, and hits him hard with a car. Instead of fighting back, Brushfire decides to just give up, and Gravity flies away. On his way home, he notices a large coliseum like thing, and as he flies into it, he is teleported away with a 'FWASSH'.

Waking up, he realizes that he doesn't feel to well, and wakes up to see a group of superhumans, Hank Pym, the Wasp, Medusa, Firebird, Spider-Man, Venom, the Hood, and Kraven. After being informed and quarreling a bit with Venom, Wasp takes away the Hood cigarettes, and the others all angrily yell at him. As they try to figure it out, Wasp explains what happened on Battleworld years ago, when a voice speaks out at them.

Nobody reacts to his message that they must all kill one another, and Wasp tries to explain who he is. The Hood is the first to even consider attacking the others, but Kraven the Hunter stops him with ease. Kraven remarks that he couldn't hurt anyone in the room, except maybe Pym. Venom is the next to consider resorting to violence, and he attacks Spider-Man, the one who he hates the most. After a brief scuffle, he murders Spider-Man.

In his dying words, he confuses Medusa with his wife telling her that he loves her, and then appears to die. Venom screams out to get his reward, but Medusa reacts violently towards him, telling him that all he will get is punishment from her, as she prepares to attack....
name: The Great Beyond

description:
Overview

The Hood has persuaded Spider-Man to reveal his true identity. Dr. Pym and the Wasp have a long overdue talk about their relationship and Deathlok leads the team to the strange city called Sanctuary. Is this the way home, or is it the survivors last battlefield?
name: Phantasm

description:
Overview

Storm Shadows quest for an ancient family artifact takes him around the globe this time to the streets of Moscow! Who is the mastermind behind the threat to Storm Shadows family? Why are they doing what theyre doing? How does the beautiful Pale Peony factor in? The red-hot solo action continues!

Larry Hama The Godfather of G.I. Joe -- is back!

Eddie Brock may be pushing back against his symbiote host, Venom. Is his resistance for naught? Plus: Spider-Man vs. the Neo-Luddites!

  1. Planet of the Symbiotes Chapter One: The Far Cry! (Spider-Man, Venom, Carnage)
  2. Street Fear (Steel Spider, Masters of Vengeance)
  3. Ghosts (Scarlet Spider, Shadowforce Alpha).

Planet of Symbiotes Part 2 and the continuation of the story Ghosts are in Spider Man Super Special 1.

The alternate cover is the back cover- it's a flipbook.
name: Planet of the Symbiotes Chapter One: The Far Cry!; Street Fear; Ghosts

description:
Overview

The threat of annihilation from the humans has subsided, leaving a trail of death and destruction in its wake. Now alone in solitude, the Elite Blue warrior KIANI struggles to come to grips with the shattered pieces of the war's aftermath, yet the profound truth she discovers will forever change her existence. Continuing directly from the pages of FATHOM Volume 2, Kiani's own series begins here, and the world of FATHOM will never be the same again! Written by Vince Hernandez, illustrated by Marcus To, and colored by Peter Steigerwald, this is the first must have new Aspen title of 2007!

In the tradition of ORIGIN, Marvel reveals the shocking secret history of Captain America! In 1940 there was a man who had many of the same qualities as Steve Rogers, save for one, the color of his skin, and TRUTH is his story!
name: The Future

description:
Overview

Tranquility is no longer the small, quiet town it was,

and Sheriff Lindo has her hands full keeping it from getting worse! Whether it's the continuous incarceration of dangerous super folks or strange teenage visitors in town, it's definitely going to be a difficult week!
name: Time of the Season

description: Trapped in Russia, the Birds face off against the Secret Six - just as one of her team wrests control of the mission from Oracle! Plus, the return of a very cool character to the DCU!
name: Whitewater Part 2: Permafrost

description: The Secret Six make their move on the Birds as Oracle struggles to regain control of the team she's spent years building.
name: Whitewater Part 3: Storm Front

description:
The Confessor takes center stage as he offers Brian the chance to be his sidekick--but can Brian survive the reality of stepping into the world of superheroes?

After meeting the Confessor, Brian Kinney starts a training to become his sidekick, Altar Boy.

He captures an Enelsian posing as Crackerjack.
name: Learning the Game

description:
Features

  • Kodiak Episode 2: Daddy's Little Girl
  • Black Rogue Episode 1: A Troupe of Strolling Players...
  • LA-X Episode 5: The Black Hornet
  • Slim & Nun Episode 5: Mick The Quick
  • Miss Adventure Episode 5: Meet Mr. Mentos
  • Salem: The New Girl in Town
1st appearance of War Machine
name: War Machine

description: Tony Stark and the Masters of Silence attack Justin Hammer's base to set the foul deed Justin committed straight.
name: Put The Hammer Down!
Dust To Dust
Ground Zero

description:
Parts 1 of the 4-Part 'A Game of Chance,' written by Steve Englehart (BATMAN: DARK DETECTIVE) with art by Tom Derenick (JLA) & Mark Farmer (JLA: THE NAIL) and covers by Mike Zeck & Jerry Ordway (DEADSHOT covers)! In this amazing story, the spotlight falls on the long-lost 'Detroit League': Steel, Vixen, Vibe, Gypsy and team leader Martian Manhunter! J'onn J'onzz takes the novice members of the untested Justice League to a remote location for some badly needed training -- but as luck would have it, Amos Fortune intends to build up his Royal Flush Gang's reputation by destroying the fledgling group!

NOTE

Commander Steel and his grandson, Steel, are two separate, different characters. Steel is already credited under the name Hank Heywood.
name: A Game of Chance, Part One: Deal

description:
Part 2 of the 4-Part "A Game of Chance," written by Steve Englehart (BATMAN: DARK DETECTIVE) with; Art by Tom Derenick (JLA) and Mark Farmer (JLA: THE NAIL) and covers by Mike Zeck and Jerry Ordway (DEADSHOT covers)! In this amazing story, the spotlight falls on the long-lost "Detroit League": Steel, Vixen, Vibe, Gypsy and team leader Martian Manhunter!J'onn J'onzz takes the novice members of the untested Justice League to a remote location for some badly needed training - but as luck would have it, Amos Fortune intends to build up his Royal Flush Gang's reputation by destroying the fledgling group!

NOTE

Commander Steel and his grandson, Steel, are two separate, different characters. Steel is already credited under the name Hank Heywood.
name: Bet

description:
A Game of Chance, Pt. 3

Continuing the lost adventure of the Detroit League! Vixen is the key player when Amos Fortune loses control of his Royal Flush Gang... but the young Leaguers may still need beginners' luck if they're going to escape with their lives!

NOTE

Commander Steel and his grandson, Steel, are two separate, different characters. Steel is already credited under the name Hank Heywood.
name: Raise

description:
The conclusion of the lost adventure of the Detroit League! The fate of the JLA hangs in the balance as Gypsy gets a glimpse of what the future holds for her newfound partners while saving Aquaman from certain death! Events in this story lead directly into JSA CLASSIFIED #14!

NOTE

Commander Steel and his grandson, Steel, are two separate, different characters. Steel is already credited under the name Hank Heywood.
name: All In!

description: The Justice League honors the U.N.'s request as Wonder Woman and Aquaman are spotted preventing natural disasters far from the warring countries they've been banned from entering... but who makes up the mysterious task force surveying the volitile situation in person?
name: Secret History, Sacred Trust, Part Two of Six

description: Still deep under cover? and violating a United Nations sanction ? the JLA infiltrates enemy lines and comes face-to-face with their meta-humans!
name: Secret History, Sacred Trust, Part Three of Six

description: Part 4 of the 6-part "Sacred Trust." The JLA sinks deeper and deeper undercover...until their cover is blown wide open on the battlefield ? leaving their mission against two warring armies of metahumans a failure!
name: Secret History, Sacred Trust, Part Four of Six

description: Part 5 of the 6-part "Sacred Trust." The JLA's cover's been blown wide-open, and the team is at the mercy of the two rebel armies of Meta Humans!
name: Secret History, Sacred Trust, Part Five of Six

description: Concluding the 6-part 'Sacred Trust.' The U.N. restrictions are off and so are the undercover guises the JLA have been working behind - so the JLA confront the Meta-Armies head-on, with explosive force!
name: Secret History, Sacred Trust, Part Six of Six

description: The 5-part story "4th Parallel," written by Dan Slott and Dan Jurgens with Art by Jurgens and Trevor Scott, kicks off in the 48-page JLA CLASSIFIED #32, and continues two weeks later in JLA CLASSIFIED #33! When lifetime loser Dareen Profitt finds a way to imprison he League's master villain Dr. Destiny and wrests control of the reality-warping Materiopticon, his luck seems likely to change. Which is bad for the JLA and the DCU as we know it!
name: Point of Origin

description:
Superman stars in a tale of Professor Cobalt's clinic!

Professor Cobalt's Quack Clinic -- Trapped in the Snow -- Rescued -- Ingrid Svenson's Inheritance -- Introducing "Miss X" -- Message to the Major Part 2 -- Claim Jumpers -- The Jagtooth Gold Mine.

Superman: Professor Clarence Cobalt runs a clinic where he claims to cure infantile paralysis. When he tries to place an ad in the Daily Planet, Clark throws him out and vows to expose Cobalt as a fraud. He and Lois visit the clinic where Lois poses as a patient and Superman eavesdrops, discovering that Cobalt and his assistant Grafton are indeed frauds. However, Cobalt and Grafton discover that Clark and Lois are reporters, and lock them up in the clinic so they can learn how much the Planet knows. Superman breaks out and steals the clinic's patient records, which he delivers to the Planet. In an attempt to save themselves, Cobalt and Grafton threaten all their patients with death if they talk but after Superman visits the patients, they descend on the clinic and threaten to lynch Cobalt and Grafton. Superman promises to protect them from the mob if they confess their crimes.
name: Professor Cobalt's Quack Clinic

description: JLA CLASSIFIED ships twice in February, as the 5-part sory "The 4th Parallel" heats up! Issue #34 features Part 3, as the Red King continues his fact-finding exploration of the multi-verse and discovers a second splinter world. And on this world it seems Batman may have the upper hand... for now!
name: Worlds Apart

first_appearance_locations.name: Stryker's Island Maximum Security Internment Center

location_credits.name: Stryker's Island Maximum Security Internment Center

description: JLA CLASSIFIED ships twice in February, as the 5-part sory "The 4th Parallel" heats up! In issue #35, the final world created by Doctor Destiny's Materioptikon is completely dominated by the Red King... as the Justice League of America is dismantled one member at a time!
name: Torrential Reign

description: Part 3 of the 5-part "Kid Amazo." It's time to start picking sidesbut will Amazo sit still for his only "son" choosing the hero's path? Not likely!
name: Kid Amazo, Part Three: The Birth of Tragedy!

description:
Clark Kent and Lois Lane investigate a rehabilitation home that may not be as benevolent as it seems.

The Brentwood Rehabilitation Home -- The Track Meet Fix -- Fight to the Finish -- No Greater Courage -- The Blue Raider -- The Return of the Gorrah!! -- Shoes, Hardware, Meats -- Hollywood Advisor -- Busy Signal -- The Vanished Explorer.

Superman: Clark is amazed when Lois agrees to go on a date with him. As he calls at her house he finds her on the phone pledging a donation to the Brentwood Rehabilitation Home for wayward boys. Clark says he's heard bad things about the home but Lois doesn't believe him, so instead of going on their date, they drive out to the home for a tour. The home's owners, Mr and Mrs Tweed, impress Clark and Lois with the facilities but just as they are leaving, one of the boys, Davey Merrill, climbs over the wall to talk to them. He claims the Tweeds maltreat the boys and use them as slave labour to produce goods that they sell for profit.

Lois wants to return to the home to gather evidence, but Clark feigns cowardice so he can slip away and change into Superman. As Lois and Davey re-enter the home, they narrowly escape an attack from Black Satan, the watchdog, but are captured by the Tweeds inside the home. Davey is put in a small locker as punishment and Lois is locked in a cell in the basement.

Superman returns to the home and, after freeing Davey and Lois, takes on Mr Tweed. Tweed tries to defeat Superman with various attacks but Superman is unaffected. However, Mrs Tweed has recaptured Lois and together the Tweeds tie her to a table with a circular saw, threatening to cut her in half unless Superman leaves them alone. Superman disables the saw and captures the Tweeds as they are trying to escape in an elevator.
name: The Brentwood Rehabilitation Home

description:
1. Cover by Ross Andru and Dick Giordano.
  2. "The Action Comics Story" written by E. Nelson Bridwell and lettered by Typeset. A 2 page overview of the history of Action Comics and its stars throughout its 41 year history.
  3. "The Life Story of Superman!" written by Martin Pasko, penciled by Curt Swan, inked by Frank Chiaramonte, colored by Adrienne Roy and lettered by Gasper. Superman's life story.

Notes:

  • 64 Pages with no ads.
  • "The Action Comics Story" appears on the inside front and back covers.
  • "The Life Story of Superman!"
  • Chapter 1 "Planet on the Edge of Oblivion!".
  • Chapter 2 "A Legend is Born!".
  • Chapter 3 "Call Me Superman!".
  • The story continues in Action Comics #524.
name: The Life Story of Superman!

description:
Conduit returns to his base, Pipeline, after his fight with Superman from Adventures of Superman #0. While we see more of the origin of Kenny Braverman (aka Conduit) and Clark Kent, we find that Conduit once worked for the CIA before they betrayed him. Conduit continues his quest to kill Clark Kent, and plans on attacking him at the reopening ceremony of the Daily Planet. He and his Pipeline agents attack, and Clark Kents quick thinking protects his secret identity. Clark Kent drops down a hole created by Conduit, as Superman arrives. Superman defeats Conduit at Centennial Park, at the base of the Superman memorial statue, and the Metropolis SCU take him away. However, construction workers find the corpse of Superman within the statue of Superman, much to everyones confusion.

Notes:

  • A Zero Hour crossover issue.
  • Triangle 1994 #40.
  • Chronological continuation from Adventures of Superman #0.
  • Chronological continuation in Superman: The Man of Steel #38.
name: Peer Pressure Part 4: The Yesterday Man

description:
What will happen to Superman's body? Fighting erupts in Metropolis, and it's Cadmus and Westfield vs. Luthor's men and Supergirl! Also, all over the world, people struggle to accept Superman's death.

Featuring the new Supergirl.

Notes:

  • The cover is a homage to Action Comics #1, except it is Supergirl lifting the car.
  • Special thanks to Tom Grummett and Doug Hazlewood.
  • WLEX News and reporter Scott Harris appears.
  • Superman does not appear in this issue.
  • Continued from Adventures of Superman #498.
  • Continues in Superman: The Man of Steel #20.
  • Triangle 1993 #4.
  • Chronological continuation from Adventures of Superman #498.
  • Chronological continuation in Superman: The Man of Steel #20.
name: Funeral for a Friend Part 2 Re-Actions

first_appearance_locations.name: Stryker's Island Maximum Security Internment Center

location_credits.name: Stryker's Island Maximum Security Internment Center

description: Forest of Fiends! -- The Beast -- The Chain
name: Forest of Fiends!

description:
The World Beyond the Mists! -- Challenge (a text poem with illustrations, it recounts Conan's previous encounters with Thoth-Amon)

The sequel to The World Beyond the Mists is in Savage Sword of Conan #104
name: The World Beyond the Mists!

description: 1. Barbarians of the Border - "The Most Off-Beat Conan Story Ever" -- 2. A Short History of Savage Sword -- 3. The Father of Conan (Article about the creator of Conan Robert E. Howard) -- 4. The Story behind "Conan of the Border" -- Conan with his Chroniclers.
name: Barbarians of the Border!

description: In the Ape-Bat of Marmet Tarn, the story continues right where The Savage Sword of Conan #90 left off. This issue also contains a "Gary Kwapisz Portfolio."
name: The Ape-Bat of Marmet Tarn

description: The Shatterer of Worlds continues the Devourer of Souls story in Savage Sword of Conan #96. Conan must stop the Devourer's resurrection. Also contains the short story "The Vezek Inn" which asks what must a barbarian do to get a good night's sleep? Answer: a lot of fighting!
name: The Shatterer of Worlds

description: Picking up where US War Machine left off, Stark is furious with Jim Rhodes and Nick Fury for using his designs to develop the War Machine armors.
The Death of Luthor! -- Supergirl Goes to College!
name: The Death of Luthor!

description: Boy Blue discovers the real identity of the Adversary. Also, Pinocchio returns from the dead.
name: He's Only a Bird in a Gilded Cage: Chapter Four of Homelands

description:
Features Include:
The Torch Goes Wild!
Beyond the Purple Veil!
name: The Torch Goes Wild!

description:
Features Include:
The Torch Meets Iceman!
The Salesman
The House of Shadows!
name: The Torch Meets Iceman!

first_appearance_locations.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

location_credits.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

description:
The Human Torch has the power to create the heat and light of a supernova. So how is it that Plantman is able to douse his flame with nothing but the dew of acorns? Is it something to do with the Plantman's nocturnal visit to the Human Torch's house, when he threw a bucket of water over him - or shall we put this tale down to one of Stan's off days?

We have to rely on the Doctor Strange story to salvage this issue, as the Master of Mystic arts encounters "Witchcraft in the Wax Museum." Can the good Doctor use his powers to overcome the evil that lurks therein? Another tale of mystery wrought by Stan and Steve.
name: Prisoner Of The Plantman

description: Its a Team 7 reunion in this action packed chapter of bullets and smoking barrels! Includes a pin-up by Tim Sale.

Michelangelo has grown tired of not being part of the surface world and has become Cowabunga Carl: a turtle mascot that can be hired for parties, etc. Donatello has installed a microphone and headset in the head of the costume as well as various other gadgets and monitors Michelangelo from the turtle van.

During one of his appearances at a hockey rink, Mikey tries to stop a purse snatcher but only manages to make a mess of things and after being detained for running out onto the ice, requires Casey Jones' help to escape.

Afterwards, in the parking lot Mikey and Donatello see the thief and begin a car chase that is joined by the Nightwatcher, a vigilante crime-fighter that Mikey adores, but who soon gives up the chase. Mikey fails again to catch the thief and they lose him, but Cowabunga Carl must make it to a birthday party, so Donatello agrees to search for the man.

Mikey makes a final stand against the thief as he is driving by the birthday party and to the enjoyment of the kids captures the man and returns the purse to the old woman it belongs to.

Later, Splinter threatens to forbid him and Donatello to go out as Cowabunga Carl if they do not stop interfering in the lives of men, while Michelangelo dreams of being able to make a difference like the Nightwatcher.
name: Michelangelo

description: Donatello creates a device to be able to find life forms. While playing around with it he finds a non-human life form that isn't one of the turtles or Splinter. He and Splinter go to investigate and they discover a huge bat-like creature. Donatello saves Splinter from being carried off by the creature but he is then taken himself. Splinter returns to the sewer for weapons and grabs Mikey to go along with him. They find Donatello and the creature at the docks where Donatello is trying to reason with the creature. Mikey and Splinter jump in and scare the creature off under Donatello's protests as he felt he was making progress and says that the creature just wants to go home. Afterward, Donatello tries to boost the power on his life-form detector and it blows up.
name: Donatello

description:
April's life has changed a lot: her and Casey Jones have moved in together and she has been contracted by Mr. Winters to travel the world in search of artifacts for him. His latest desire is a statue called the fourth general that he believes is in the rain forests of Central America. She is given Mr. Winters private jet to have at her disposal and the aid of his enormous monetary assets.

During her travels she picks up a guide named Sebastian and together they search and run down many leads. April even follows some leads and finds Leonardo on his pilgrimage before continuing her quest for the statue.

Upon finding it, Sebastian reveals that it is a powerful god that deserves a sacrifice and attempts to sacrifice her to the statue. He is interrupted and killed, along with his men, as another group, claiming to be Coasta Rican Government officials lay claim to the statue. Upon overhearing the leader on the phone saying he will be selling the statue, April hijacks the truck and makes a run for the plane.

She manages to board the plane and have it take off as a massive battle erupts on the airfield over the statue.
name: April

description:
Splinter sends Leonardo on a Pilgrimage. That of the Five-Fold Path, so he may learn and grow to become a better leader.

The five paths take him to many places across the globe:

5 - Courage - Iceland - he stands up to a whaling vessel hunting an endangered whale

4 - Compassion - Portugal - he rescues slave children from a container ship and leaves them to authorities to have a better life

3 - Selflessness - Mongolia - he offers up himself in place of a captured beastman, and is captured himself during the battle allowing the beastman to escape. The beastman returns later with many other of his kind and rescues Leonardo and tends to his wounds

2 - Humility - Japan - he is tested by the trainer of Homato Yoshi (Master Splinter's master) who insults him continuously throughout their battle before besting Leonardo and telling him that the Five-Fold Path is not traveled alone

1 - Community - Costa Rica - he has become known as the Ghost of the Forest and protects the innocent and the forest. However he has grown to hate community as the world is beautiful, yet man is so ugly in their actions to it and each other. April states that he should look at community more personally and he realizes that community is family and that he is ready to go home.
name: Leonardo

description: Sam and Twitch are trying to find the proof to nail Chief Banks, but he fires them before they can. Later Jason Wynn orders all support around Banks to be shut down, and Banks crumbles under the pressure and commits suicide.
name: Evil

description:
Guardian patrols the street of Metropolis while Luthor and Supergirl continue to investigate what's happened to Superman's body and whether or not Superman is really still alive.

Notes:

  • "DC Universe" one page text piece featuring "R.I.P. Superman" what's new for 1993 to include Vertigo leaving DC, "New Stars on the Horizon" featuring the debut of Darkstars in their own title, "How to Draw Lobo" and "DC Bullets" Lee Moder makes his debut in Wonder Woman #72, Scott Peterson and Bill Kaplan are DC's newest editors, Tim Truman and John Ostrander team up for the last issue of Hawkworld #32 and Kevin Dooley paid $10 and a ham sandwich to get his name in this issue of DC Universe.
  • Last $1.25 issue.
  • Triangle 1993 #8.
  • Chronological continuation from Adventures of Superman #499.
  • Chronological continuation in Superman: The Man of Steel #21.
name: Funeral for a Friend, Part 6: Who's Buried in Superman's Tomb?

description:
There's a mysterious strongman in a leopard-print leotard committing robberies across Metropolis, and it's up to Clark Kent and Lois Lane to get to the bottom of things.

  1. The Strong-Man Robberies
  2. The Southpaw
  3. The Chase
  4. The Whole Story
  5. The Easter Island Gods
  6. The Gorrah's Blackmail Racket
  7. The Hollywood Jewel Theft Ring
  8. The Gringo Gang.

Superman: Metropolis is being plagued by a strongman in a leopard skin who is staging a series of robberies. When Lois and Clark see that Herculo, the strongman in a circus visiting Metropolis, fits the description of the thief, they visit the circus to investigate. When they meet Herculo, he challenges Superman to a fight, so Clark slips away and returns as Superman. After defeating Herculo as part of the circus performance, Superman discovers that the circus clown was the previous strongman and now dresses up as Herculo to stage the robberies. The clown tries to escape by hurling the ringmaster into a flaming tank, but while Superman saves the ringmaster, the real Herculo knocks out the clown.
name: The Strong-Man Robberies

description:
Superman and Lois Lane uncover an insurance scam!

Superman: Clark goes to pick up Lois for a relaxing afternoon in the park, but Lois insists on going to see a crippled old lady, Mrs Davis, whose sister has recently died. Mrs Davis tells them that she is the beneficiary of a cheap insurance policy she bought from a Mr Fullerton. Mrs Grady, her neighbour, believes that Fullerton is a con artist. While talking to the two old ladies, Lois develops a headache and is about to take some of Mrs Davis's aspirin when Clark detects that it is actually a slow-acting poison.

When Lois and Clark visit the drugstore where the aspirin was bought, they witness Mrs Grady being hit by a car and killed. Tom Bruce, a thug in the pay of political boss Martin, whips up a mob by telling them that the drugstore owner caused Grady's death. Superman shows up in time to prevent the mob from storming the drugstore, but Martin shows up and tells the police to let Bruce go.

Lois goes to Fullerton's office but is thrown out by Fullerton. Undeterred, she comes back later and breaks into his private office, but is captured by Bruce and another thug. Superman arrives just in time to save Lois from being murdered by the thugs, but again Martin gets the thugs freed from police custody.

Lois returns to Fullerton to bluff him into confessing by claiming she has proof of his insurance racket, but Fullerton forces Lois to go with him to Martin's home. There, we discover that Martin was behind the insurance scam, and was killing off the policy-holders to collect their premiums without Fullerton's knowledge. Martin shoots Fullerton to keep him quiet and is about to kill Lois when Superman shows up to save her yet again. This time they collect evidence of Martin's guilt and put an end to the scam.

Contents

  1. The Life Insurance Scam
  2. Summer Vacation in Cambodia
  3. The Red Raiders
  4. The Missionary and the Cannibals
  5. The Washington Spy Ring
  6. The Puppet Murder Case
  7. The Crooked Cop
  8. Captain Kidd's Treasure.
name: The Life Insurance Scam

description:
In this prequel issue of the Slingers series, Ricochet, Hornet, Prodigy and Dusk meet in a quiet corner of the city to home their abilities and train undisturbed. While the training session goes well for the three boys, Dusk has difficulty, particularly with an exercise that involves jumping from one roof to another.
Prodigy is adamant that if she won't make the jump she should be removed from the team. Hornet attempts to encourage her, telling her that he and the other two members will turn their backs so that she can make the jump without them watching.
The situation goes badly wrong though, as Dusk misses the jump and falls to her death.
name: The Learning Curve

description:
1. Cover by John Byrne.
  2. "Different Worlds" (Superman and Wonder Woman vs Darkseid) written and penciled by John Byrne, inked by George Perez, colored by Tom Ziuko and lettered by John Costanza.
  3. Individual Chapters:
    1. Chapter One: "First Date..."
    2. Chapter Two: "Fallen Idols"
    3. Chapter Three: "Broken-Mirrors"
    4. Interlude:
    5. Chapter Four: "Battle!"
    6. Chapter Five: "This Hollow Victory..."
  4. Superman Pinup by Linda Medley and Art Adams. (Superman with Mr. Miracle, Wonder Woman, Dr. Fate, Martian Manhunter, Blue Beetle, Booster Gold, Firestorm, Guy Gardner, Captain Marvel, Wally West, Black Canary, the Creeper, Batman and Robin).
  5. "True Love?" (Lois Lane) plotted by John Byrne, scripted by Roger Stern, penciled by Kurt Schaffenberger, inked by Jerry Ordway, colored by Petra Scotese and lettered by Bill Oakley.
  6. Superman rescuing a Small Child Pinup by John Bogandnove.
  7. "Games People Play" (Lex Luthor) written by John Byrne, penciled by Dick Giordano, inked by John Beatty, colored by Tom Ziuko and lettered by Albert De Guzman.
  8. Superman and two Punks Pinup by Kevin Maguire and Dave Gibbons.
  9. "A Friend in Need" (Jimmy Olsen) plotted by John Byrne, scripted by Roger Stern, penciled by Curt Swan, inked by Murphy Anderson, colored by Tom Ziuko and lettered by Albert De Guzman.
  10. Superman and Lois Lane Pinup by Mike Zeck.
  11. "The Dark Where Madness Lies" (Superman and Manbat) written by John Byrne, penciled and inked by Mike Mignola, colored by Petra Scotese and lettered by Bill Oakley.
  12. Superman and Brainiac Pinup by Walter Simonson.

Notes:

  • A homage cover to the Giant Superman Annuals of the 1960s.
  • Series continues as a weekly series as Action Comics Weekly.
  • Series returns to a monthly schedule with issue #643.
  • In the Interlude the newspaper has the headlines "Mike Carlin revealed as Potts Clone" and "Kar(en?) I had Swamp Thing's Baby!".
name: Different Worlds / True Love? / Games People Play / A Friend in Need / The Dark Where Madness Lies

description: In the tie-in issue for the OMAC project, Martian Manhunter appears to Lois Lane to protect her from Superman. But what has Superman done that warrants this. As John Stewart, Hawkman, Black Canary and The Flash try to get Superman to come with them, a dazed and confused Superman doesn't understand what is happening, why are his friends cornering him and just whose blood is on Superman's hands? Gail Simone answers these questions as John Byrne draws in this issue that ends with a stunning revelation that could change the world forever.
name: Sacrifice, Part 2 - End Of Identity

description: "The Mice in Pink" battle an alien invasion! There are aliens among us and the only ones who know they're here are Pinky and the Brain! But what started as a scheme for world domination by trading guided tours of Earth for alien secrets, goes horribly, horribly wrong! Those wacky extra-terrestrials are out of control! But fear not, 'cause here com the MIP!
name: MIP : Mice in Pink : Comig Soon to Take Over Your World

description:
My Son... Is He Man Or Beast?

Yes, Superman! You created this grotesque creature... Now, as its guardian, fate decrees you must treat it like your own flesh and blood... but before you accept the eerie challenge, ask yourself one question -- My Son... Is He Man Or Beast?

Duel of Doom!

Kandor... once a giant metropolis on Krypton, Superman's native planet, and now a mini-city coveted by the evil computer, Brainiac! Don't panic! The super-due will save it! But, ironically, deep within the bottled city, their teamwork only inspires a desperate Duel of Doom!

My Son... Is He Man or beast? -- When radio-biologist Jan Nagy dies, he makes Superman the guardian of his son Gregor, but Gregor is violently opposed to this. Some years in the past, when Jan was working on a new element called metamorphon, the atomic furnace in which it was being created threatened to explode, and Superman prevented the disaster by dousing the furnace in Nagy's swimming pool. Gregor was beside the pool at the time and although Superman wrapped him in his cape, the vapours gave Gregor the power to mutate into almost any type of being simply by wishing it. Gregor views this as a curse and blames Superman for his condition. Superman eventually convinces Gregor that his powers can be used for good and agrees to train him. Gregor helps Superman with several missions until one day Superman takes him to his Fortress. While Superman is away on a mission an emergency call comes in from a trapped sub. Gregor discovers he can acquire Superman's powers by wishing for them and goes to aid the sub. However, his transformations are temporary and his powers give out while he deep in the ocean. Superman shows up in time to bring him to the surface but his injuries are too great and he dies.

Duel of Doom! -- two Kandorian scientists, Arvor and Yllura, compete in the Annual Super-Scholarship Trophy presented by Superman and Supergirl. Yllura's specialty is archaeology, and her mission takes her into some unexplored caves where she encounters some hideous statues from a lost civilization. The statues appear to come to life and threaten her. Meanwhile, Arvor, whose specialty is electronics, is testing out his infra-scope, which allows him to see with his mind rather than his eyes. While using his anti-grav belt to fly over a lake, the belt malfunctions and he plunges into the water. He discovers an underwater chamber which leads into the cave system where Yllura is trapped. Together they find a way out of the caves and back to safety.
name: My Son... Is He Man or Beast?; Duel of Doom!

description:
A surprise snowstorm hits Metropolisin the middle of summer!

Superman: Metropolis is blanketed by snow in the middle of summer. While Clark is visiting a weatherman to see if he knows what is happening, he hears a message on the radio from a Laura Vogel, asking Superman to meet her so she can explain what's going on. However, while Vogel and a friend are on their way to the meeting, their car gets stuck in the snow, and Vogel's friend tries to get to the meeting place on foot. However, she is attacked by 3 men in Arab dress who release a strange glowing sphere towards her. Just as Superman arrives, he sees the woman vapourized by the sphere.

Lois had also arrived on the scene and she too is attacked by a glowing sphere. Superman leaps to the rescue, but the Arabs have taken Laura Vogel hostage. Superman whisks Lois away and returns to trail the Arabs and their captive in a car.

Meanwhile, in the Sahara desert, Laura Vogel's brother Carlton has discovered Ulonda, the Lost City. Just as they are about to enter it, however, they too are attacked by a band of Arabs who release a horde of blazing spheres at them, and they are all vapourized.

Back in Metropolis, Superman see Vogel being forced aboard a strange sky-vessel. As he tries to save her, he is attacked by a glowing sphere which knocks him unconscious. He is taken captive aboard the skyship where Laura tells him that an evil mastermind named Zolar is behind the bizarre weather and glowing spheres, both of which he has constructed using vast stores of radium.

During this time, the skyship has taken Superman and Laura to Ulonda and Zolar's headquarters. Superman breaks free and battles Zolar's skyships and glowing spheres, eventually forcing Zolar to surrender.

Contents

  1. A Summer Snow
  2. The "Fred Norman" Jinx
  3. Ghosts
  4. The Attack
  5. Elagabalus, Monkeys, Footprint, Toothpicks, Gentleman Jim
  6. The Headhunters and the Incan Treasure
  7. Dr. Mixxo's Protection Racket
  8. Tall Timber
  9. Death on the Set!
  10. Mottled Death.
name: A Summer Snow
